result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd A Schouten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Todd A Schouten
Current: 1581A Cty Rd D, Emerald, WI 54013 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2016)
Prior: 1851 Cty Rd D, Emerald, WI 54013 United States

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:24)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Weber - pleading to Ct 1 16CF14 - dismiss the remaining counts, 15CF41 - w/held 2 yrs prob - AODA - $518
State - requests the dismissed cases be read-in - repeater allegation not dismissed - w/held sent 2 yrs prob with 30 days jail conditional jail
Weber - argues no jail time

Deft - 16CF14 Ct 1 - waives prelim hearing
          16CF14 Ct 1 - pleads no contest - waives rights & JT

COURT:  16CF14 Ct 1 - waiver of prelim voluntary - finds probable cause for bind over
plea voluntary - finds deft guilty
w/held sentence 2 yrs probation
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg
***$150 BOND APPLIES FROM TWO OF THE CASES - BALANCE ON PAYMENT PLAN***
  CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
complete AODA if DOC decides you need it - continue any treatment entered into
60 hrs community service complete within the first six months 

DISMISS & READ-IN:  15TR136, 15CF41, 16CF14 Ct 2

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:27)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Weber - offer made - requests plea date

COURT:  set plea date
bond continues
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:01)   MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Weber - return on Motion hearing - State was checking on video related to traffic stop
State - have Deputy Scott here for testimony - video has not been located
Weber - would accept testimony that the video could not be located
State - made diligent effort to locate the video 
Weber - acceptable to defense - request matter come back 3-8-16 at 1:45

COURT:  accepts that the State took diligent effort
bond continues
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:57)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - there is not a squad video in this case
Weber - officer testified there was a video in the car - just finding out there isn't a video
COURT:  take some testimony regarding video
State calls Deputy K. Knotz - sworn
Weber - requests transcript from previous motion hearing - can't recall what was testified to at last hearing
State - wasn't the DA at the previous hearing - not a complicated case - would prefer just starting from beginning
Continued cross of witness - witness identifies the deft
Cross by J. Weber
Redirect by State
Recross by Weber
State rests
Weber - need to explore the issue of the video

COURT:  continue matter for 30 days for Boyceville Police Chief to locate video
  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:56)
State - just provided video to Ms. Weber - requests continued motion date
Weber - would like to review dvd before submitting it

COURT: would counsel like to submit the dvd for court to view
bond continues
  Motion hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten with Attorney Julie A. Weber appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:35)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - here on Motion to Suppress 
          - calls Deputy K. Knotz - sworn - witness identifies the deft
Cross by Weber - moves to continue to see the video of stop

COURT:  matter continued - counsel to submit any legal authority prior to next hearing
  Motion hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten, in custody, appeared with Attorney Julie A. Weber.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:49)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Weber - will waive prelim hearing - waiver filed

Deft - waives prelim - waives reading and pleads not guilty
Weber - requests motion hearing

COURT:  waiver of prelim voluntary - finds probable cause for argn
10 days to file motions - set for 45 minutes
15TR136 to tagalong
  Motion hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant, Todd A Schouten, in custody, appeared with Attorney Julie A. Weber.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:53)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - Ms. Weber is taking over for Mr. Krave - requesting prelim

COURT:  bond continues
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
